snippet: Sam, a defensive end from Missouri, was selected by the St. Louis Rams in the seventh round, becoming the first publicly gay player to be drafted by an N.F.L. team.
abstract: Michael Sam, defensive end from Missouri, becomes first publicly gay football player to be chosen in the NFL draft after St Louis Rams selects him in the final round; Sam's draft status was seen as barometer of whether the NFL was ready to accept an openly gay player.

byline.contributor: Zach Schonbrun and Andrew Keh contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Sam, a defensive end from Missouri, was selected by the St. Louis Rams in the seventh round, becoming the first publicly gay player to be drafted by an N.F.L. team.

headline.main: In Historic Pick, Rams Take Michael Sam in Final Round of Draft
headline.print_headline: Historic Choice in Final Round of N.F.L. Draft
